- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6).

-->

## Steps to reproduce

1. Initialize the source directory from host1:
```powershell
# From Host1:
PS /home/tu> ni -Type Directory -Force test/src/x

    Directory: /home/tu/test/src

Mode                 LastWriteTime         Length Name
----                 -------------         ------ ----
d----          11/26/2020 12:00 PM                x

PS /home/tu> "1" > test/src/x/a1
```

2. Copy the directory the first time into host2, with -Container:$false:
```powershell
# From Host2:
PS /home/tu> $s=New-PSSession -HostName host1-UserName tu
PS /home/tu> Copy-Item -FromSession $s -Path /home/tu/test/src/x -Destination test/dest/x -Recurse -Container:$false -Verbose
```

3. Run the copy command a second time
```powershell
# From Host2
PS /home/tu> Copy-Item -FromSession $s -Path /home/tu/test/src/x -Destination test/dest/x -Recurse -Container:$false -Verbose
```

## Expected behavior

Copy-Item overwrites the destination files and doesn't create new directories, as if -FromSession wasn't used
```powershell
# on running the command for a 2nd time
PS /home/tu> Copy-Item -Path test/src/x -Destination test/dest/x -Recurse -Container:$false -Verbose
VERBOSE: Performing the operation "Copy File" on target "Item: /home/tu/test/src/x/a1 Destination: /home/tu/test/dest/x/a1".
```

## Actual behavior

Copy-Item creates a subdirectory with the same name as the source directory:
```powershell
# on copying the 2nd time
PS /home/tu> Copy-Item -FromSession $s -Path /home/tu/test/src/x -Destination test/src/x -Recurse -Container:$false -Verbose
VERBOSE: Performing the operation "Copy Directory" on target "Item: /home/tu/test/src/x Destination: /home/tu/test/src/x".
VERBOSE: Performing the operation "Create Directory" on target "Destination: /home/tu/test/src/x".
VERBOSE: Performing the operation "Copy File" on target "Item: /home/tu/test/src/x/a1 Destination: /home/tu/test/src/x/a1".
```

If the destination directory name is different, this happens:
```powershell
PS /home/tu> Copy-Item -FromSession $s -Path /home/tu/test/src/x -Destination test/dest/y -Recurse -Container:$false -Verbose
VERBOSE: Performing the operation "Copy Directory" on target "Item: /home/tu/test/src/x Destination: /home/tu/test/dest/y/x".
Copy-Item: An item with the specified name /home/tu/test/dest/y/x already exists.
VERBOSE: Performing the operation "Copy File" on target "Item: /home/tu/test/src/x/a1 Destination: /home/tu/test/dest/y/x/a1".
```

## Environment data

```none

----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.0
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.0
OS                             Linux 5.4.0-52-generic #57-Ubuntu SMP Thu Oct 15 10:57:00 UTC 2020
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}

WSManStackVersion              3.0
```
title: Copy-Item -FromSession doesn't honor -Container:$false
